list_page_teaser: The spiritual portraits of Lucy and her husband Ricky show why they so frequently disagree.  Click to learn more!
description_html:
This gallery contains images of the Ricardos and the Mertzes, characters on the show I Love Lucy, which aired from 1951-1957.

The show was the most-watched television program for four of its six seasons, ranking third in its first year and second in 1956-57. It was one of earliest successful situation comedies on television and people continue to enjoy the show today.

image_list.title: Lucy Ricardo
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: Lucy's spiritual portrait shows she is ______________.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents Lucy's dominant personality trait, Feeling: passion; amiability; friendliness; compassion; warmth; very slight/moderate/strong preference for emotion/empathy/subjectivity over logic/reason/objectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for being the/tendency to be emotional/personal/subjective over the logical/rational/objective.

The Red in X's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making emotional/personal/objective rather than logical/rational/objective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for being/tendency for being more emotional/personal/subjective rather than logical/impersonal/objective.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_dom_very_slight_preference: It's important to note this preference/tendency is very slight, and X can be quite _____ in some situations/when the situation calls for it.
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Lucy's auxiliary personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; pragmatic; practical; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to new experiences; very slight/moderate/strong preference for facts over ideas.

The Yellow in X's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing the/tendency to see the world more in terms of facts rather than of ideas; need for sensual stimulation.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_aux_very_slight_preference: It's important to note this preference is very slight, and X can be quite _____ in some situations/when the situation calls for it.
image_list.disclosure_html: This story contains some affiliate marketing links. Clicking on one of these and making a purchase helps support SeeOurMinds.com.
image_list.story_html_img: Idea: only include images with stories for family and friends.
